intro: Teucrium trifidum, commonly known as three-lobed germander, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Teucrium trifidum is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
